author: abdel.stark
content: I fixed the issues in the tool. Will do another session half an hour before our sync meeting

author: abdel.stark
content: I ran it 3 times in a row without issues. Basically when transaction pools are full transactions were dropped, meaning some gaps in nonces. To fix that I periodically retrieve the nonce for all accounts. No too frequently because there are 1000 accounts used for the tests.

author: sky.cactus
content: I believe at the moment there are only 3041, 3044, 3045, 3046.  There is a need for additional EIPs.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: I've started a "proto-EIP" for the EIP-2930 changes, IMO we should tackle EIP-2930 before EIP-1559 since it's a) sooner (Berlin) b) simpler and c) sets the precedent for handling EIP-2718 txs going forward ; it also seems like a good test case for making sure that new functionality gets RPC consideration as early as possible. https://gist.github.com/ryanschneider/723d8e2bce0829de9d6beb43639b6d3e  Happy to discuss more in <#779922457631916064> or <#804019759934078987> whichever you find more appropriate.  I'm definitely willing to help usher this into a full EIP.

author: timbeiko
content:
Looking at the checklist for tomorrow, a few things that are still missing are:
1. Checking the connections between the various nodes on the network. It seems like all nodes have >4. Is that sufficient?

author: timbeiko
content: 2. Nethermind confirming it can send + include both legacy and 1559-style txns

author: timbeiko
content: 3. Nethermind having  access to machine logs and be able to retrieve them when needed

author: timbeiko
content: 4. Nethermind confirm that there are no disconnections between nodes when idle

author: timbeiko
content: 5. Define progression levels for the testing procedure (at what gas levels we start) (cc: <@!574864862338088960>)

author: timbeiko
content: 6. Confirm that the tx generator tool works ahead of the call (execute 2 - 3 blocks) (cc: <@!574864862338088960> )
